Field.ElementLabel: Today's Date
Sex of Child
Date of Baby's Birth
Age of Child (months)
Age of Child (weeks)

As you read each description of the baby's behavior below, please indicate how often the baby did this during the LAST WEEK (the past seven days) by choosing one of the numbers. These numbers indicate how often you observed the behavior described during the last week.

(1) Never
(2) Very Rarely
(3) Less Than Half the Time
(4) About Half the Time
(5) More Than Half the Time
(6) Almost Always
(7) Always
(X) Does Not Apply

The "Does Not Apply" (X) choice is used when you did not see the baby in the situation described during the last week. For example, if the situation mentions the baby having to wait for food or liquids and there was no time during the last week when the baby had to wait, click the (X) "Do Not Apply". "Does Not Apply" is different from "Never" (1). "Never" is used when you saw the baby in the situation but the baby never engaged in the behavior listed during the last week. For example, if the baby did have to wait for food or liquids at least once but never cried loudly while waiting, click the (1) "Never" choice.

Please be sure to choose a number for every item.

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - How Often Did Your Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (1) make talking sounds when s/he was ready for more food?
(2) seem angry (crying and fussing) when you left her/him in the crib?
(3) seem contented when left in the crib?
(4) cry or fuss before going to sleep for naps?
(5) look at pictures in books and/or magazines for 5 minutes or longer at a time?
(6) stare at a mobile, crib bumper or picture for 5 minutes or longer?
(7) play with one toy or object for 5-10 minutes?
(8) play with one toy or object for 10 minutes or longer?
(9) laugh aloud in play?
(10) repeat the same movement with an object for 2 minutes or longer (e.g. putting a block in a cup, kicking or hitting a mobile)?
(11) smile or laugh after accomplishing something (e.g., stacking blocks, etc.)?
(12) smile or laugh when given a toy?
(13) enjoy being read to?
(14) enjoy hearing the sound of words, as in nursery rhymes?
(15) enjoy gentle rhythmic activities, such as rocking or swaying?
(16) enjoy being tickled by you or someone else in your family?
(17) enjoy the feel of soft blankets?
(18) enjoy being rolled up in a warm blanket?
(19) enjoy listening to a musical toy in a crib?
(20) look up from playing when the telephone rang?
(21) protest being placed in a confining place (infant seat, play pen, car seat, etc)?
(22) startle at a sudden change in body position (for example, when moved suddenly)?
(23) move quickly toward new objects?
(24) show a strong desire for something s/he wanted?
(25) watch adults performing household activities (e.g., cooking, etc.) for more than 5 minutes?
(26) squeal or shout when excited?
(27) notice low-pitched noises (e.g. air conditioner, heating system, or refrigerator running or starting up)?
(28) notice a change in light when a cloud passed over the sun?
(29) notice the sound of an airplane passing overhead?
(30) notice a bird or a squirrel up in a tree?
(31) notice fabrics with scratchy texture (e.g., wool)?
(32) appear sad for no apparent reason?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - During Feeding, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (33) lie or sit quietly
(34) squirm or kick?
(35) wave his/her arms?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Going to Sleep at Night, How Often Did Your Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (36) fall asleep within 10 minutes?
(37) have a hard time settling down at sleep?
(38) settle down to sleep easily?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Being Dressed or Undressed During the Last Week, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (39) squirm and/or try to roll away?
(40) smile or laugh?
(41) coo or vocalize?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Put Into the Bath Water, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (42) smile?
(43) laugh?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Tossed Around Playfully How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (44) smile?
(45) laugh?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - During a Peekaboo Game, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (46) smile?
(47) laugh?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - How Often Did Your Baby Enjoy Bouncing Up and Down:
Field.ElementLabel: (48) while on your lap?
(49) on an object, such as a bed, bouncer chair, or toy?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Being Held, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (50) pull away or kick?
(51) seem to enjoy him/herself?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When the Baby Wanted Something, How Often Did S/He:
Field.ElementLabel: (52) become upset when s/he could not get what s/he wanted?
(53) have tantrums (crying, screaming, face red, etc.) when s/he did not get what s/he wanted?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Placed in an Infant Seat or Car Seat, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (54) wave arms and kick?
(55) squirm and turn body?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - How Often did Your Baby Make Talking Sounds When:
Field.ElementLabel: (56) riding in a car?
(57) riding in a shopping cart?
(58) you talked to her/him?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: ONE Week Time Span - When Rocked or Hugged, in the Last Week, How Often Did Your Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (59) seem to enjoy her/himself?
(60) seem eager to get away?
(61) while being fed in your lap,how often did the baby seem eager to get away as soon as the feeding was over?
(62) after sleeping, how often did the baby cry if someone didn't come within a few minutes?
(63) when put down for a nap, how often did your baby settle down quickly?
(64) when it was time for bed or a nap and your baby did not want to go, how often did s/he whimper or sob?
(65) when face was washed, how often did the baby smile or laugh?
(66) when hair was washed, how often did the baby vocalize?
(67) when playing quietly with one of her/his favorite toys, how often did your baby enjoy lying in the crib for more than 5 minutes?
(68) when your baby saw a toy s/he wanted, how often did s/he get very excited about getting it?
(69) when given a new toy, how often did your baby immediately go after it?
(70) when placed on his/her back, how often did the baby squirm and/or turn body?
(71) when frustrated with something, how often did your baby calm down within 5 minutes?
(72) when your baby was upset about something, how often did s/he stay upset for up to 20 minutes or longer?
(73) when being carried, how often did your baby push against you until put down?
(74) when tired, how often did your baby show distress?
(75) at the end of an exciting day, how often did your baby become tearful?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: TWO Week Time Span - When Introduced to an Unfamiliar Adult, How Often Did the Baby:
Field.ElementLabel: (76) cling to a parent?
(77) refuse to go to the unfamiliar person?
(78) never "warm up" to the unfamiliar adult?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: TWO Week Time Span - When You Were Busy With Another Activity and Your Baby Was Not Able to Get Your Attention, How Often Did S/He:
Field.ElementLabel: (79) become sad?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: TWO Week Time Span - When Singing or Talking to Your Baby, How Often Did S/He:
Field.ElementLabel: (81) soothe immediately?
(82) take more than 10 minutes to soothe?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: TWO Week Time Span - When Showing the Baby Something to Look at, How Often Did S/He:
Field.ElementLabel: (83) soothe immediately?
(84) take more than 10 minutes to soothe?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: TWO Week Time Span - When Patting or Gently Rubbing Some Part fo the Baby's Body, How Often Did S/He:
Field.ElementLabel: (85) soothe immediately?
(86) take more than 10 minutes to soothe?
(87) when in the presence of several unfamiliar adults, how often did the baby continue to be upset for 10 minutes or longer?
(88) when visiting a new place, how often did the baby get excited about exploring new surroundings?
(89) when an unfamiliar adult came to your home or apartment, how often did your baby cry when the visitor attempted to pick her/him up?
(90) when familiar relatives/friends came to visit, how often did your baby get excited?
(91) when rocking your baby, how often did s/he take more than 10 minutes to soothe?
